gurmukhi: GumMq AG EGXM ]bdMq bkqR qyjXM ]clMq qXwgqy qnM ]BxMq dyvqw DnM ]567]
transliteration: Ghoumant Agh Oghayan|| Badant Baktra Tejayan|| Chalant Tyaagade Tanan|| Bhanant Devtaa Khanan||567||
translation: The warriors are roaming on all the four sides for the destruction of sins and are challenging one another; the brave fighters are leaving their bodies the gods are shouting “Bravo, Bravo”.567.

gurmukhi: CutMq qIr qIKxM ]bjMq Byr BIKxM ]auTMq g`d s`dxM ]ms`q jwx m`dxM ]568]
transliteration: Chhoutant Teer Teekhanan|| Bajant Bher Bheekhanan|| Outhant Gadd Saddanan|| Mamatt Jaan Maddanan||568||
translation: The sharp arrows are being discharged and the terrible kettle-drums are resounding; the intoxicating sounds are being heard from all the four sides.568.

gurmukhi: krMq cwcro crM ]ncMq inrqxo hrM ]puAMq pwrbqI isrM ]hsMq pRyqxI iPrM ]569]
transliteration: Karant Chaacdaro Charan|| Nachannd Nirtano Haran|| Puant Paarbatisiran|| Hasant Pretaniphiran||569||
translation: Shiva and his Ganas (attendants) are seen dancing and it seems that the female ghosts are laughing and bowing their heads before Parvati.569.

gurmukhi: fkMq fwkxI fulM ]BRmMq bwj kuMflM ]rVMq bMidxo kiRqM ]bdMq mwgXo jXM ]570]
transliteration: Dakant Dakanidulan|| Bhramannd Baaj Koundalan|| Radant Bandino Kritan|| Badant Maagdho Jayan||570||
translation: The vampires are roaming and the horses are moving creating a circular spectacle; the warriors are being made prisoners and are hailing.570.

gurmukhi: FlMq Fwl au`FlM ]iKmMq qyg inrmlM ]clMq rwjvM srM ]ppwq aurvIAM nrM ]571]
transliteration: Dhalant Dhaal Uddhalant|| Kheemant Teg Nirmalan|| Chalant Raajavan Saran|| Paapat Urveeyan Naran||571||
translation: There are knockings of the blows of the swords on the shields and with the arrows being discharged by the kings the humans and monkeys are falling on the earth.571.

gurmukhi: BjMq AwsurI suqM ]iklMk bwnrI puqM ]bjMq qIr qu`pkM ]auTMq dwruxo surM ]572]
transliteration: Bhajant Aasurisoutan|| Kilank Baanaripoutan|| Bajant Teer Touppakan|| Outhant Daarouno Suran||572||
translation: On the other side the monkeys are shrieking; on account of what the demons are fleeing; the sounds of arrows and other weapons are creating the terrible and tumultuous resonance.572.

gurmukhi: BB`k BUq BY krM ]cc`k caudxo ckM ]qq`K p`KrM qury ]bjy inn`d isMDury ]573]
transliteration: Bhabhakk Bhoot Bhai Karan|| Chachakk Chaudano Chakan|| Tatakkh Pakkharan Ture|| Bade Ninadd Soundhure||573||
translation: The groups of ghosts are feeling frightened and perplexed; the armoured horses and roaring elephants are moving in the battlefield.573.

gurmukhi: auTMq BY krI srM ]mcMq joDxy juDM ]iKmMq au`jlIAsM ]bbrK qIKxo srM ]574]
transliteration: Outhant Bhai Karisaran|| Machannd Jodhane Judhan|| Khimant Ujjleeasan|| Babarkh Teekhanndsaran||574||
translation: The gods are also becoming fearful on seeing the terrible war of the warriors; the white swords and sharp arrows are being showered.574.

gurmukhi: jwgVdMg ju`JXo BwgVdMg BRwqM ]rwgVdMg rwmM qwgVdMg qwqM ]
transliteration: Jaagaddan Jujjhyo Bhaagaddan Bhraatan|| Raagaddan Raamannd Taagaddan Taalan||
translation: Ram saw his brother Lakshman fighting,

gurmukhi: bwgVdMg bwxM CwgVdMg Cory ]AwgVdMg Awkws qy jwn Ery ]575]
transliteration: Baagaddan Baanan Chhaadaddan Chhodhe|| Aagaddan Aakaas Te Jaan Ore||575||
translation: And he discharged the arrows touching the sky.575.

gurmukhi: bwgVdMg bwjI rQI bwx kwty ]gwgVdMg gwjI gjI vIr fwty ]
transliteration: Baagaddan Baajirathibaan Kaate|| Gadgaddan Gadjigadiveer Daaeee||
translation: These arrows chopped the riders on chariots and horses, but still the warriors stood firmly in the field;

gurmukhi: mwgVdMg mwry swgVdMg sUrM ]bwgVdMg bXwhYN hwgVdMg hUrM ]576]
transliteration: Maagaddan Mdare Saagaddan Sooran|| Baagaddan Byaahain Haagaddan Huran||576||
translation: Ram killed the brave fighters who were wedded by the heavenly damsels.576.
